home.upcomingSubtitle: Compete across Asia. Qualify for the Grand Championship.
home.featuredTitle: The Largest BJJ Tournament in the Marianas
home.featuredDesc: What started as a local Guam tournament in 2007 has grown into an international phenomenon spanning 6 countries with over 1,300 competitors and $2M in economic impact.

event.title: Marianas Open 2026
event.scheduleDesc: Divisions run simultaneously across 6 mats. Black belt finals in the evening.
event.travelDesc: Guam is a visa-free destination for Japanese, Korean, and Taiwanese nationals. Direct flights available from Tokyo, Osaka, Seoul, Manila, and Taipei.
event.flightsDesc: United Airlines and regional carriers offer direct flights from major Asian cities. Flight time: 3-4 hours from most hubs.
event.hotelsDesc: Hyatt Regency Guam, Dusit Thani Guam Resort, and Holiday Resort & Spa offer competitor group rates.
event.visaDesc: Guam Visa Waiver Program applies to citizens of Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, and many other countries for stays up to 45 days.
event.step1Desc: Create your competitor profile on the Asian Sport Jiu-Jitsu Federation website.
event.step2Desc: Find 'Marianas Open 2026' in the event listings and select your division.
event.step3Desc: Pay the registration fee online. Early bird discounts available.

calendar.title: 2026 Pro Series
calendar.subtitle: 7 events across 6 countries. One grand championship.
calendar.mapSubtitle: From local qualifiers to the international stage — compete across Asia and earn your spot at the Marianas Open.
